column4: what could be the filesystem of my usb stick, ubuntu says it is not fat, ext3, ext3, ...
usbfs mount it but I get weird folders and I can't find my files?
I get folders: 001, 002, 003, 004 and a file: devices
what happened when you tried vfat?
and did you create a directory for it to mount ?
wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sda1
I will copy the files on another computer before formating my pen drive as fat, then, it sould mount properly...
hmmm my usb camera automatically mounts itself in a self creating directory
mebreya: the best way to format usb stick for compatibility is : mkfs.vfat -F 32 /dev/sda1 ?
strange, I could not put vfat on the usb stick, I'm presently using FAT16 (msdos) and it work well. Is it possible to put vfat on a 128 meg usb stick?
